sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"改进，改善"之意。
means: improve ： 最常用词，多指状态或性质上的深刻或重要改进，也可指自身能力的提高。
better ： 多用于口语，指适当地改善原来并非很差的状态或性质，也指社会地位、经济状况的改善。
perfect ： 语义强，通常指使方法、技术等达到完善美好的境地。
refine ： 侧重指使语言、仪态等变得文雅、优美，也可指技艺等的提高。

entry.def: Better is the comparative of good .
Better is the comparative of well .
If you like one thing better than another, you like it more.

example.ex: I like your interpretation better than the one I was taught...
example.tran: 你的解释比我以前学过的更让我喜欢。

example.ex: I'd like nothing better than to join you girls...
example.tran: 我最喜欢和你们女孩子在一起了。

entry.def: If you are better after an illness or injury, you have recovered from it. If you feel better, you no longer feel so ill.

example.ex: He is much better now, he's fine...
example.tran: 他现在好多了，身体状况不错。

example.ex: The doctors were saying there wasn't  much hope of me getting better.
example.tran: 医生们说我好转的希望不大。

entry.def: You use had better or 'd better when you are advising, warning, or threatening someone, or expressing an opinion about what should happen.
entry.tran: （用于建议、警告、威胁、发表意见等）最好

example.ex: It's half past two. I think we had better go home...
example.tran: 现在两点半了。我想我们最好还是回家吧。

example.ex: You'd better run if you're going to get your ticket...
example.tran: 想买到票的话，你最好跑几步。

entry.def: If you say that you expect or deserve better, you mean that you expect or deserve a higher standard of achievement, behaviour, or treatment from people than they have shown you.
entry.tran: 更大成就；更好行为；更好待遇

example.ex: We expect better of you in the future...
example.tran: 我们希望将来你有更大的成就。

example.ex: Our long-suffering mining communities deserve better than this.
example.tran: 我们长期受苦受难的采矿群体应该得到比这更好的待遇。

entry.def: Your betters are people who have a higher status or rank than you do.

example.ex: Sit down and be quiet in front of your elders and betters.
example.tran: 在长辈和上级面前要老老实实地坐着。

entry.def: If someone betters a high achievement or standard, they achieve something higher.

example.ex: He recorded a time of 4 minutes 23, bettering the old record of 4-24...
example.tran: 他用时4分23秒，刷新了4分24秒的原纪录。

example.ex: As an account of adolescence it could hardly be bettered.
example.tran: 作为描写青春期的书，它已几臻完美。

entry.def: If you better your situation, you improve your social status or the quality of your life. If you better yourself, you improve your social status.

example.ex: He had dedicated his life to bettering the lot of the oppressed people of South Africa...
example.tran: 他毕生致力于改变南非受压迫人民的命运。

example.ex: Our parents chose to come here with the hope of bettering themselves.
example.tran: 我们的父母选择来到这里，希望能够改善自己的生活。

entry.def: Better is used to form the comparative of compound adjectives beginning with 'good' and 'well.' For example, the comparative of 'well-off' is 'better-off.'
entry.tran: （用于构成以 good 和 well 开头的复合形容词的比较级，如 well-off 的比较级为 better-off）

entry.def: You can say that someone is better doing one thing than another, or it is better doing one thing than another, to advise someone about what they should do.

example.ex: You are better eating just a small snack than hurrying a main meal...
example.tran: 你最好简单吃点快餐，不要着急着慌地吃正餐。

example.ex: Wouldn't  it be better putting a time-limit on the task?...
example.tran: 是不是给这项任务规定一个时限比较好？

entry.def: If something changes for the better, it improves.

example.ex: Dreams of changing the world for the better.
example.tran: 让世界变得更美好的梦想

entry.def: If a feeling such as jealousy, curiosity, or anger gets the better of you, it becomes too strong for you to hide or control.
entry.tran: （嫉妒、好奇心、愤怒等感情）使不能自制

example.ex: She didn't allow her emotions to get the better of her.
example.tran: 她没有感情用事。

entry.def: If you get the better of someone, you defeat them in a contest, fight, or argument.
entry.tran: （在比赛、打斗或争论中）战胜，打败

example.ex: He is used to tough defenders, and he usually gets the better of them.
example.tran: 他习惯了彪悍的后卫，通常都能战而胜之。

entry.def: If someone knows better than to do something, they are old enough or experienced enough to know it is the wrong thing to do.

example.ex: She knew better than to argue with Adeline...
example.tran: 她不至于和阿德琳发生争执。

example.ex: It's  bad enough to have anyone joke about such a serious matter but a member of the police force should know better.
example.tran: 拿这么严肃的事情开玩笑已经够糟的了，身为一名警察更不应该这样做。

entry.def: If you know better than someone, you have more information, knowledge, or experience than them.
entry.tran: 比…更了解（或更渊博、更有经验）

example.ex: He thought he knew better than I did, though he was much less experienced...
example.tran: 虽然他经验远没有我丰富，但他认为他比我懂行。

example.ex: My sister still claims she cheated on us at cards, but I know better.
example.tran: 我妹妹仍然说她和我们玩牌的时候捣了鬼，其实我心知肚明。

entry.def: If you say that someone would be better off doing something, you are advising them to do it or expressing the opinion that it would benefit them to do it.

example.ex: If you've  got bags you're better off taking a taxi...
example.tran: 你要是大包小包的，不如打的算了。

example.ex: Their stance seems to be that a baby or child is better off in its country of birth.
example.tran: 他们似乎认为婴儿或者小孩还是呆在自己出生的国家为好。

entry.def: If you go one better, you do something better than it has been done before or obtain something better than someone else has.

example.ex: Now General Electric have gone one better than nature and made a diamond purer than the best quality natural diamonds.
example.tran: 现在通用电气公司已经制造出了巧夺天工的钻石，其纯度比最好的天然钻石还要高。

entry.def: You say 'That's better' in order to express your approval of what someone has said or done, or to praise or encourage them.
entry.tran: （表示赞成、表扬或鼓励）很好，这就对了

example.ex: 'I came to ask your advice — no, to ask for your help.' — 'That's better. And how can I help you?'
example.tran: “我来征求你们的意见——不对，请求你们帮助。”——“这还差不多。我们怎么帮助你？”

entry.def: You can say 'so much the better' or 'all the better' to indicate that it is desirable that a particular thing is used, done, or available.

example.ex: Use strong white flour, and if you can get hold of durum wheat flour, then so much the better...
example.tran: 使用高筋白面粉，如果你能弄到硬粒小麦面粉，那就更好了。

example.ex: If there's good skiing, breathtaking scenery and you don't  need to catch a plane, all the better!
example.tran: 如果有好的滑雪场、令人叹为观止的美景，又不用赶飞机，那就再好不过了。

entry.def: You can use expressions like 'The bigger the better' or 'The sooner the better' to say that you would prefer it if something is big or happens soon.

example.ex: The Irish love a party, the bigger the better...
example.tran: 爱尔兰人喜欢聚会，规模越大越好。

example.ex: The fewer things in the room the better.
example.tran: 房间里的东西越少越好。

entry.def: If you do something the better to do something else, you do the first thing in order to be able to do the second thing more effectively.
entry.tran: 为了更好地…；以便更有效地…

example.ex: She came on every ride herself, the better to instruct her eager pupils.
example.tran: 每一个骑乘项目她都要亲自试一试，以便更好地指导她那些跃跃欲试的小学生。

entry.def: If you intend to do something and then think better of it, you decide not to do it because you realize it would not be sensible.

example.ex: Alberg opened his mouth, as if to protest. But he thought better of it.
example.tran: 阿尔伯格张了张嘴，似乎想要申辩，但想想又放弃了。

entry.def: If you say that something has happened or been done for better or worse, you mean that you are not sure whether the consequences will be good or bad, but they will have to be accepted because the action cannot be changed.
entry.tran: 不论好坏；不管结果怎样

example.ex: I married you for better or worse, knowing all about these problems.
example.tran: 这些问题我都知道，不管怎样我还是嫁给了你。

means.word_mean: 1. one having claim to precedence; a superior;

sentences.sentence: "the common man has been kept in his place by his betters"

means.word_mean: 3. the superior one of two alternatives;

sentences.sentence: "The editor improved the manuscript with his changes"

means.word_mean: 1. (comparative of `good') superior to another (of the same class or set or kind) in excellence or quality or desirability or suitability; more highly skilled than another;

sentences.sentence: "You're a better man than I am, Gunga Din"
"she's better in math than in history"

means.word_mean: 2. (comparative of `good') changed for the better in health or fitness;
3. (comparative and superlative of `well') wiser or more advantageous and hence advisable;

sentences.sentence: "it would be better to speak to him"
"the White House thought it best not to respond"
"argued for the better part of an hour"

means.word_mean: 1. comparative of `well'; in a better or more excellent manner or more advantageously or attractively or to a greater degree etc.;
2. from a position of superiority or authority;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  betera (adjective), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch beter and German besser, also to best
